titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell, Receipt to Joseph H. Gardner
CWG13719

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 3

body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To Joseph H. Gardner Dr.

row.cell: To cash to pay expenses to Lexington
" cash to pay expense on train to Lexington
" cash to pay expens on train to Lexington
" cash expense on train to Richmond
" cash expense on train to Lexington

body.p:
For
For the use of the 2nd & 3rd Battalions 14th Regiment Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry.
There being no money in the Quarter Masters hands the above was absolutely necessary for paying expences on the road from Irvine to Lexington hawling clothing arms &c. distance forty miles

I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were a necessary for the public service. ^no transportation having been furnished these Battalions^
A A Curtis AQM 16 Ky C

Received at Frankfort on, the 20th of March, 1863, of John W Finnell Adjutant General, Quarter-master Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Forty one -- Dollars and Seventy Cents in full of the above account.

Approved
By order of the governor
Jno. W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky Vols

11No 41
NO. 12.
No. 90 Abstract B A Qr. 186
Joseph Gardner
Dollars 41.70 /100
Paid 20 March 1863
Transp
allowed Aug 8th 1863
Rec No 2
J 202
J 10 J. W. F
